website_summaries.verdict: Excellent price point for a wheel paint that looks great and really brings old wheels back to life.
pros: Offered in three common color options that are often found on steel or aluminum wheels or on plastic hubcaps, bringing them to a like-new condition
Especially designed to resist problems from rust
Easy to use, so you don't have to spend much time applying the paint
cons: Longevity is a little questionable for this low-priced wheel paint

customer_reviews.title: this is bright silver or aluminum, not gunmetal
customer_reviews.text: the cap in the photo for 248927 looks like it may be slightly darker, like gunmetal or forged steel, but it is closer to a bright aluminum color you see in stock automotive wheels. not a problem, just FYI if anyone is assuming the dark cap in the photo is what the paint will come out looking like.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Great finished result
customer_reviews.text: Painted my 4 rims with one can of this. Looks great. Has held up through the weather as I park my car outdoors. Just pay attention to the prep work and your finished result will be fantastic! EDIT: still satisfied with product given it's so affordable, but I live in MN, and after one brutal winter with the salt here, the rims will need to be touched up. So expect it to be a yearly project if you live in a similar climate.
customer_reviews.author: Mariah T

customer_reviews.title: Went on smoothly with excellent coverage.
customer_reviews.text: The only wheel paint I have found that matches the factory black on my Ford FX4 20 inch wheels. Went on smoothly with excellent coverage.
customer_reviews.author: David S.

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: I recently revamped the steel wheels on our 10 year-old Pontiac Vibe and was pleased with the results- this is about as close to a factory original semi-gloss finish as you can get. I hurried through a lot of it (wheel covers obscure most of the view, I just wanted to treat some light surface rust) but I expect the paint to outlast the car at this point. Not sure I would recommend this for a front-facing cast/alloy/forged wheel finish, but it might be worth a shot if you prepped correctly.
customer_reviews.author: CMY

customer_reviews.title: Very good short term, long term is questionable
customer_reviews.text: I stripped my steel wheels down to bare metal and prepped and primed the surface. This pain goes on great, covers well, and provides an even depth and finish, apply slowly and multiple coats and it works great. I was pretty happy for about 8-9 months with the finish. I wash my car probably once every 3 months, so not often, and I live in the North-East with (4) seasons. After about 8-9 months, the finish started to pit and I saw rust coming through. Its good paint, but I'm not sure how long it is intended to last, before re-application.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just take your time!
customer_reviews.text: All I can say is wow!!!! Incredibly easy to work with; take your time with prep work and you will be rewarded!
customer_reviews.author: Chad R. Cady

customer_reviews.title: Looks great seems very durable
customer_reviews.text: Product went on smoothly and looks beautiful on my white jeep grand Cherokee. It's all in the preparation of course. After dremel and hand sanding the wheels I did 3 coats of the paint and then three coats of rustoleum 2x clear gloss.
customer_reviews.author: FIguy

customer_reviews.title: Krylon spray paints the #1 Good quality product since 1947
customer_reviews.text: My moms 99 accord LX with 40k miles in amazing condition no rust rot or dents original paint except for bumper covers that were all scratched from people bumping her in parking lots, we had those painted at a body shop.. but the plastic hubcaps were very dull and and a couple of scrapes so I sanded them all with 400 grit, got some of the scraps out tack clothed them and did a light 1st coat to promote adhesion the followed by 2 thicker coats let dry 24 hrs and put them back on and the car looks fantastic and btw my mom is 80 and drives everyday and still works as a case manager
customer_reviews.author: Zeppe

customer_reviews.title: Great, but buy two cans
customer_reviews.text: Works great! I only bought one can based off some of the other reviews. Dont do it ... buy two and here's why - now I get to remove my rear wheels again and put a couple more coats on. Painted the wheels while I had them off for another reason ... the fronts look great because there are 4-5 coats to really make it look good and it has a semi gloss finish. The rears got 3 coats I think before I ran out ... they appear dull and a lighter shade.
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: Worked great on bike rims
customer_reviews.text: Had to give my mountain rims a four of paint and clear coat. Seen this when I was looking for clear coat and thought I would give it a try. Turned out great. Put 3 coats on and the nice part is that it states to put each coat on a couple minutes apart so you don’t have to wait long between coats . End result turned out great and so far is protecting the rims good. I’ll try to update my review later after wear and tear but for now it’s protect it great even wear the brakes rub the rim.
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: Great for Hubcaps and Factory wheels.
customer_reviews.text: I used this to respray my factory hubcaps. After a thorough cleaning and prepping the paint flowed smoothly and consistently during the entire time. The color is as close to factory as you can get in a can but be sure to prep your work to avoid bleed through of old contaminants. They also matches another set of factory wheels i tried it on.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: It really sprayed out lumps and uneven paint I instantly ...
customer_reviews.text: It really sprayed out lumps and uneven paint I instantly tossed it. YES I DID TWERK IT. I ended up going to the store and picked up same brand and did not have this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Looks good
customer_reviews.text: I'm only giving this four stars because I cannot evaluate the durability of the paint yet. I will say that it applied very nicely and the finished product looks great. It was a very close match to the silver on my original wheels. I used this on some 16x7 wheels with a lot of surface area to cover. I applied two coats to the back (inside) of the wheel and to the sealing beads on the barrel. I applied four coats to the front face. I used about one can per wheel with that amount of coverage which I thought was pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: kv1

customer_reviews.title: The product peeled of the aluminum weels
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product to put a clear coat on my aluminum wheels. The wheels were perfectly cleaned and had no residue, wax,cleaner or anything else on them. I followed the directions and sprayed 2 coats. I let the product dry for 2 days and when i lightly used my finger nail to scrape the wheel, the product pealed off. So it did not adhere to the wheel. I tried thoroughly cleaning and preparing the wheel again and spraying it according to directions. The same thing happened. This product is terible for aluminum wheels.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product if it lasts
customer_reviews.text: Great paint, easy to get a nice finish. I sprayed 5-6 medium wet coats over freshly painted wheels and the finish is outstanding, hard to imagine it was done with a rattle can. Note, this is a lacquer paint but no where on the can does it mention so. As such it makes for easy coverage and no recoat window, so paint / repaint at your leisure. That said lacquers don't play well with Enamels - you will want an Enamel clear to go over an Enamel base as a Lacquer clear can cause lifting when used over Enamel. Historically lacquers aren't as durable as Enamels, time will tell how well this holds up!
customer_reviews.author: hansonjon17

customer_reviews.title: Awesome buy
customer_reviews.text: My rims look amazing. We sanded them down and painted them. My car had been sitting some where for close to a year. When we finally got it up and running they had rust stains. Now they look amazing. Yes smellis kind of strong, but what spray paint isn't strong. Took 3 cans for 16 inch rims and the bumper piece to cover. My brother did two coats on each rim.
customer_reviews.author: mallorie

customer_reviews.title: Happy With Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Sprayed some stock aluminum wheels that I had got at the junkyard with Rustoleum Wheel paint (black and clear coat). Cleaned, then wet sanded the wheels, cleaned again with some rubbing alcohol and sprayed 3 coats. Allowed to dry for 36hrs and then cleaned and sprayed a 4th coat. After 10mins I sprayed two coats of clear back to back. Wheels look great for $20 worth of paint, only time will tell durability.
customer_reviews.author: Criswell

customer_reviews.title: The cast aluminum wheels on my Harley Sportster look better than new
customer_reviews.text: I always go to Rustoleum products for all my automotive/motorcycle needs. Always take the time to properly prep the intended surface! After washing well with detergent and water, and scuffing the surface with a "scrubby sponge" I used 3M surface prep to insure a good result. This product applies nicely, coats evenly, and leaves a really durable finish. I followed-up with the clear coat and the cast aluminum wheels on my Harley Sportster look better than new.
customer_reviews.author: G. E. Glaum

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt last over 2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: I applied this to my grill following the directions exactly and even using a primer. 2 weeks later its already coming off.
customer_reviews.author: Zwar

customer_reviews.title: Buy now! Save time and money!
customer_reviews.text: I wish all spray cans were like these. I sanded my faded 2006 350z wheels with 250 grit and then wet sanded with same paper. This paint filled in all the gaps. I used 2 cans to cover 4 wheels. It was probably 10 coats per wheel waiting 15 minutes between coats. Bottom line is this is the only brand of spray paint I will buy from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Traci L

customer_reviews.title: Very Quick Drying Time
customer_reviews.text: I love the quick drying time. About 10 minutes. I used Rust-Oleum Automotive primer and added this while the primer is still wet. Makes the projects go really quick. Durability is yet to be tested, but seems like a nice hard finish.
customer_reviews.author: F5CobraGuy

customer_reviews.title: Good coverage and finish - minimal overspray
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use - decent coverage and not much “overspray”. The “mat” finish is a bit glossier than expected, but still happy with the results. Hopefully will hold up in Florida weather. No ice or road-salt to be concerned about here, so we’ll see.
customer_reviews.author: tallguyinFL

customer_reviews.title: Not able to use...it’s USELESS.
customer_reviews.text: Second purchase of same product. Both times when removing the cap the spray nozzle was broken. Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Corey Hansen

customer_reviews.title: recommend it
customer_reviews.text: a lot of prep work is needed but well worth the effort. I used this spray to restore my wheel covers on my 2002 Toyota Camry that I bought used. the wheel covers had deep scratches and had to do major prep work for the deep scratches to go away one prep work was done it took about 2-3 cans to spray all 4 wheel covers and came out very well
customer_reviews.author: Joselito

customer_reviews.title: Better than VHT
customer_reviews.text: Yeah couldn’t believe the results. I had to figure out how to actually use this to make it “matte” right. The key is the spray distance. If your too close it, it’s glossy, if your too far, than your wasting paint. Took about 3 cans for 4 20” tires.
customer_reviews.author: Red Cardinal 1

customer_reviews.title: Great finish!
customer_reviews.text: I sanded the exterior face of two Toyota Camry wheel covers and then spray painted each with three complete coats of spray paint. The ultimate finish was so new looking that it is impossible to distinguish the difference between all four wheel covers. Great paint.
customer_reviews.author: jimzee

customer_reviews.title: Excellent.
customer_reviews.text: I painted the wheels on my 2002 Ford Explorer with this about 8 months ago and it's holding up great. Proper prep is the key. Remove the wheels. Power wash them. Use their "etching" primer. Paint. Clear coat. Done.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew F.

customer_reviews.title: Not a Match for Tundra Rims
customer_reviews.text: I bought the steel color because I had read that it was a perfect match for my 2007 Toyota Tundra rim color. It IS NOT! Too much metallic flake to be a match. If I was painting Liberace's piano, it would be perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Ahouchin

customer_reviews.title: JUNK
customer_reviews.text: absolutely regret every putting this on my rim peeling real easy.
customer_reviews.author: Rosario

customer_reviews.title: Make it look new!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my daughter's car had trashy looking rims. This helped them look new again and made my daughter proud of her car again. You will want to use primer. I thought about skipping that step, but read the reviews that told me not to and they are right.
customer_reviews.author: ARBURG

customer_reviews.title: does the job
customer_reviews.text: Used this on my trike wheels and it seemed to seal the gloss on the aluminum rims. These rims where never that great in quality so I decided to spend the money and have them chrome plated.
customer_reviews.author: Boomer Sooner

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff!
customer_reviews.text: Great paint, fixed some blemishes on matte-black low profile rims perfectly. Also used it to touch up other black metal trim around the car. Seems resistant to wear and tear, Be aware, the compounds in the spray can be highly toxic/corrosive. Melted straight through a plastic Solo cup in a minute.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Hornaday

customer_reviews.title: Created massive orange peel on top of other Rust-oleum paint.
customer_reviews.text: Cracked and peeled on my first 2 coats of black right off. I might have applied it when the base was not 100% cured, but that was an awful result. I am hesitant to spray anything else with it now.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Hailston

customer_reviews.title: good product!
customer_reviews.text: it's light/bright silver. but it still not fit my nissan's rim. If just for scratch repair can use it blend with a little black paint untill it get the color you want.
customer_reviews.author: dinohippo

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Very good finish, lasted two summers and a northern Ontario winter without degrading. Not sure if I'd recommend it on a new vehicle or new rims, but I don't think that's what they're going for anyways.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: I've used this product on another set of wheels and it works great, now I'm gonna do the wife's vehicle so I ordered the one product I k know works.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not durable.
customer_reviews.text: Both the Steel color and the Clear topcoat paints are way too soft of a finish for wheel rims. Not durable even after curing the painted rims. Scratch and chip way too easy. Do not attempt to unmount/mount tires on the painted rims as the finish will be damaged. Save yourself a lot of problems and have your rims powder coated.
customer_reviews.author: Christian

customer_reviews.title: More Satin finish than matt. Looks great though.
customer_reviews.text: More of a black satin finish than Matt black. (I was painting over an existing Matt coat and the difference is obvious). Still 5 stars though. I like the darker satin color and finish...
customer_reviews.author: AdamA

customer_reviews.title: Pure junk
customer_reviews.text: Junk did my rims a week ago and the paint already chipping and I used the best primer so I’m not recommending this to anyone
customer_reviews.author: Holley Elkins

customer_reviews.title: gives great coverage
customer_reviews.text: You can Never go wrong with rust-oleum, and i got 2 cans for the price of one then the auto part store price
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value and good looking color
customer_reviews.text: Love the matte black it looks good to cover up chrome. great quality form great brand
customer_reviews.author: Jacob D.

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME PAINT EASY TO USE!
customer_reviews.text: Tapping off is by far the worst part about painting rims. This paint went on great and looks just as good! Painted the grill and bumper as well and I couldn’t be happier with the outcome.
customer_reviews.author: SmallsByGucci

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Was really disappointed. Wanted flat black/ matte black, but this stuff is pretty shiny. Also paint didn’t stick well to rims. Spent so much time sanding and cleaning rims, just to have the paint job make them look terrible and not last long at all! Waste of time and money. Don’t buy!
customer_reviews.author: simone sparks

customer_reviews.title: Great paint for metals!
customer_reviews.text: Used this for my BMX rims and forks. Was great paint! went on smooth and great color and finish!
customer_reviews.author: Star Wars Geek

customer_reviews.title: Too much metallic particles.
customer_reviews.text: Not a fine enough spray to look factory. Runs easily even using light coats.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Brought my wheels back to life. Hopefully it will hold up after weather and a wash.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis K

customer_reviews.title: Incredible paint
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly forgiving paint. Goes on easy, covers well, and drys fast. It gives a perfect finish even when your painting skills are not great. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Metallic finish
customer_reviews.text: Metallic finish on the paint. Looks neat. Used to paint some cobra R wheels
customer_reviews.author: sup

customer_reviews.title: Good Product - Best Value
customer_reviews.text: Does what is says it does. Follow directions and don't put on too thick. Long term will see how it holds up.
customer_reviews.author: Will Workman

customer_reviews.title: Lighter than depicted
customer_reviews.text: Nice color, but it is much lighter than the picture shows. I was looking for a near black metallic, however this is only slightly darker than the graphite sold at auto parts stores.
customer_reviews.author: Rodolfo

customer_reviews.title: Great paint
customer_reviews.text: I used this to paint the wheels on my Jeep. It was extremely easy to use! I take my Jeep off-road all the time and the paint is holding up well!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Richey

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE!  COLOR IS MANY SHADES LIGHTER THAN PICTURED!!!
customer_reviews.text: Be aware that the shade of this is MANY times lighter than what is pictured. Even the cap on top of the can is much darker than the actual color. I didn't realize this until I was finished with my project and the paint was dried. Very disappointing being that I spent money and time to have it all turned to waste.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty nice so far...
customer_reviews.text: I bought rims at a junk yard and refurbished them with this paint. I made sure to sand to remove all previous black paint from the rims before primering and painting. The paint applies very easily and gives a good finish. I definitely recommend using the Rust-Oleum primer and clear coat to give it the extra shine and protection. The online downside was that it seems to be a bit soft. I'm going to let them dry for a couple of days to see if the paint last. Will update.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Did not perform as expected
customer_reviews.text: Followed instructions and applied, but the product was runny and did not dry clear.
customer_reviews.author: Prolink

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: We have used this stuff before on wheels and its way awesome! My boyfriend bought it again to use on our new car but he hasnt done it yet. Maybe some day he will...
customer_reviews.author: Jarbells

customer_reviews.title: Dosen't adhere to the plastic
customer_reviews.text: I'm not happy with product because after proper prep work, cleaning w/ degreaser, sanding down and abrading w/scotch and cleaning with alcohol before spraying 3 light coats I didn't get sufficient adhesion of paint to my hubcaps; first car wash took the paint off the hubcap;
customer_reviews.author: Duke

customer_reviews.title: Sprays too thick, runs
customer_reviews.text: Horrible product I sprayed this at 70* and 10% humidity it ran like a marathon. Sprays thick like bed liner. I’ll stick with duplacolor
customer_reviews.author: andi fitts

customer_reviews.title: Has Metalic In It
customer_reviews.text: Has some metallic flake in it - not too much but I was hoping for none. Applied well and happy with results.
customer_reviews.author: PIRATE19

customer_reviews.title: Nice hard and clear
customer_reviews.text: Nice hard and clear, waterproof finish. Using it on tin plated containers, which tend to rust easily, since they have thin electroplating.
customer_reviews.author: Chittamoo

customer_reviews.title: Great color
customer_reviews.text: Love the color. It has silver metallic flakes which looks great in the sun.
customer_reviews.author: D Q

customer_reviews.title: Not all that.  Waste of time/$
customer_reviews.text: Ok, but not great. We decided to shoot wheels with actual clear coat from paint gun bc this takes 3 cans and still doesn’t look great or have much buildup after multiple coats.
customer_reviews.author: Peter C Turner

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Be paint for rim and furniture and it doesn't drip easily. Also perfect for touch ups
customer_reviews.author: Edison Forde

customer_reviews.title: Save some me twice!
customer_reviews.text: I did the unthinkable as I turned into parking stall I clipped my my black rims. About two months later something hit my rim and took three deep gashes out. Twice this paint has saved my rims. Follow the directions and you're golden! I would totally recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Cat S.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I mean its freaking spray paint can it does what it suppose to do.
customer_reviews.author: FireHawq

customer_reviews.title: Bright Aluminum wheels are ugly.
customer_reviews.text: Painted my alum wheels to match my F-150 crewcab.ooks great.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Stahl

customer_reviews.title: 100$ car repair
customer_reviews.text: The product is great but I sprayed it where it got on the wheel in a way that made the tires stop working and then it costed me 100$ to repair so thats great. Definitely my fault though.
customer_reviews.author: cori

customer_reviews.title: not so glossy
customer_reviews.text: Label says gloss but It never really got to a high gloss for me
customer_reviews.author: Boondoggle

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING LOOK AND QUALITY MATERIAL
customer_reviews.text: Looks absolutely amazing and gorgeous, turned out nicer than I expected. Looks like a $400 dollar job really satisfied. Interested in a sponsorship have really good things to say about this product.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie Aghaei

customer_reviews.title: Product is the right color for my automotive application “wheels” ...
customer_reviews.text: Product is the right color for my automotive application “wheels” Runs a little too much so put it on lightly
customer_reviews.author: Richard Koop

customer_reviews.title: Great Price and works well!
customer_reviews.text: Great value and made my wheels look great, even without sanding or taking tires off
customer_reviews.author: Tom Modjewski

customer_reviews.title: Great wheel clear coat!
customer_reviews.text: This is my go to clear coat when paint rims and always turns out great! Just remember light coats are better than thick coats!
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Looks great but came off first time thru a car wash.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Moseley

customer_reviews.title: Great solution to a damaged rim.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I had to buy a replacement rim for a 2009 Jeep Patriot from a junk yard. Rim had quite a bit of rust.I used 2 coats of primer and 2 coats of this paint. Wow good as new! No idea how long this will hold up but great for now!
customer_reviews.author: Cody R.

customer_reviews.title: Good rim paint
customer_reviews.text: Perfect paint for rims. Use them on my trailer rims and it worked great. 1 can did all 4 15" rims
customer_reviews.author: Jeff M.

customer_reviews.title: A perfect color match
customer_reviews.text: After scratching and gougings my cars rims from parking along curbs, this was the ideal item to solve the problem
customer_reviews.author: Gary McKenzie

customer_reviews.title: Paint
customer_reviews.text: It's spray paint. What do you want me to say? Quick shipping and a reasonable price? That's about it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer Jeff D.

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: It’s a good product, i used it on my 2011 Jeep JK, i only got about 2 wheels out of 1 can, but it’s more on me because i’m beating the butt out of it, but i would definitely recommend and buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: 1 can goes a long way great value made wheels look good
customer_reviews.author: Donald W McConnaughey

customer_reviews.title: Dries fast and covers imperfections
customer_reviews.text: Dries fast and has good coverage. Got two wheels covered with one can and could have stretched it further.
customer_reviews.author: Handsome Max

customer_reviews.title: Very durable
customer_reviews.text: I love this paint! In the spring I plan on buying another can
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Really nice paint. The spray nozzle is a bit tiring on the hand, but overall looked great
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Good wheel automotive paint.
customer_reviews.text: I am not a plastidip fan. I like paint. This is good paint and it works very well on automotive wheels if you are not a bling person. I'm not a bling person.
customer_reviews.author: shaun

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: made my jeep look stellar. I wanted that flat black wheel look... mission accomplished
customer_reviews.author: Shannon McGivney

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff.
customer_reviews.text: Restored a set of aluminum wheels. Better than my expectations. Great stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Rust-Oleum Automotive Wheel Spray Paint
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and covers well. Great value for the money, durability won't know for sure until next spring so I only gave it 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Preacherman

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Did a great job on as set of winter steel wheels
customer_reviews.author: Ruth M.

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I have used this before but could not get it at my auto store so I had to purchase one online. Product works good and the price was good.
customer_reviews.author: Pretty

customer_reviews.title: ... 4 hubcaps with one can and they came out great!
customer_reviews.text: Painted 4 hubcaps with one can and they came out great!
customer_reviews.author: AZman

customer_reviews.title: If your cheap like me but really want change the look of your ...
customer_reviews.text: This stuff really works. If your cheap like me but really want change the look of your car quick, buy this stuff and look up the videos on DIY rim painting. Awesome product
customer_reviews.author: jason b.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: great paint, used them on my truck wheels and no scrapes even after off roading a good amount
customer_reviews.author: koffalexkoff

customer_reviews.title: Works Great looks Great
customer_reviews.text: Great coverage and durable. Love the color and it goes a long way. One can did four small wheels.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Good paint. I pared it up with the etching ...
customer_reviews.text: Good paint. I pared it up with the etching primer. Looks great but still scratches off of steel wheels fairly easily.
customer_reviews.author: briandrew1

customer_reviews.title: Great for trailer rims
customer_reviews.text: I sanded the rust off my trailer rims and painted them with this. They came out great and look new!
customer_reviews.author: PASabre

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff
customer_reviews.text: Great stuff.It's spray paint. Quick shipping and a reasonable price
customer_reviews.author: Susan Dalman

customer_reviews.title: Wrong color
customer_reviews.text: We bought the can expecting it to be the advertised steel color, but it came out red. And we can’t return it either.
customer_reviews.author: Jose V.

customer_reviews.title: held up nice, went on easy!!
customer_reviews.text: This clear laid over my painted wheels very nicely, no fish eye, very light orange peal. It is very clear, no haziness, and made my wheels look very shiny. It has held up well so far!!
customer_reviews.author: kenball

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff. I originally tried another brand Duped Color ...
customer_reviews.text: Great stuff. I originally tried another brand Duped Color which was terrible. I couldn't get a smooth finish from that brand no matter what and I tried a few different colors. The Rust-Oleum went on very smoothly and came out looking very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Swirl

customer_reviews.title: Clearcoat Paint
customer_reviews.text: The product worked as advertised, was easy to use, and solved a problem for me. Rustoleum is a trusted brand.

customer_reviews.title: Even after 4 weeks dirt stuck to it.. ...

product_meta.title: Rust-Oleum 248927 Automotive High Performance Wheel Spray Paint, 11 oz., Steel
product_meta.description:
Size Name:11 oz| Color:SteelRust-Oleum Automotive High Performance Wheel Coating spray paint provides a long lasting and durable finish which restores the original look of wheels and hubcaps. Rust, corrosion and weather resistant formula with easy to apply design to change the look of any vehicle without the hassle. Any angle spray with comfort tip allows painting of hard to reach areas while reducing finger fatigue.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Rust-Oleum High Performance Wheel Coating enhances the look and color of your vehicle's wheels while keeping the surface free from rust.
feature_bullets: Rust preventative paint is suitable for use on metal wheels, plastic hubcaps and more
Oil based formula dries fast and provides exceptional durability
Dries to the touch in 10 minutes and covers up to 8 sq ft
Dent and scratch resistant wheel paint creates a long-lasting finish
Provides a glossy, high shine finish for a brand new look
Stops Rust Formula prevents corrosion and rust
Restores the original look of wheels and hub caps
Recommended for wheels made of aluminum or steel, and plastic hubcaps
